scripts.help:help: echo Prints a list of available scripts and a reminder about how to get more help.
scripts.help: echo Available scripts -- execute \`npm run help:SCRIPTNAME\` for help on SCRIPTNAME: && (npm run | grep '^\s\s\S' | grep -v 'help\|only\|postinstall\|prepare')
scripts.help:dev:1: echo Compiles frontscope and starts a server running it.
scripts.help:dev:2: echo Note the server will hot-reload the code from any
scripts.help:dev:3: echo source files as they change, to ease development.
scripts.help:doc:serve:1: echo This is like the 'dev' script, but for the
scripts.help:doc:serve:2: echo embedded documentation rather than the
scripts.doc:serve: cd tools && node pyrun.mjs mkdocs serve
scripts.help:build:1: echo Compiles frontscope and minifies the result,
scripts.help:build:2: echo producing a bundle ready for installation
scripts.build: npm run typecheck && vite build && cd tools && node pyrun.mjs mkdocs build
scripts.help:preview:1: echo Serves the most recently built files -- the
scripts.help:preview:2: echo contents of the 'dist/' directory -- for you
scripts.help:preview:3: echo to preview. This script differs from 'dev' in
scripts.help:preview:4: echo that there isn't any hot module reload. It is
scripts.help:preview:5: echo closer to what you will run in production.
scripts.help:typecheck:1: echo Checks for TypeScript errors in both .vue
scripts.help:lintx:01: echo If you would like to format your code before you
scripts.help:lintx:02: echo make a commit with git -- which has hooks to do
scripts.help:lintx:03: echo automatic formatting -- you can call this script
scripts.help:lintx:04: echo at any time. It runs 'prettier' and
scripts.help:lintx:05: echo 'eslint --fix' on the project files. Note that
scripts.help:lintx:06: echo this operation does not simply _check_ the
scripts.help:lintx:07: echo formatting of your files, it _formats_ them!
scripts.help:lintx:08: echo At least, if possible -- there are some
scripts.help:lintx:09: echo formatting/code errors that it does not know how
scripts.help:lintx:10: echo to fix. These will simply be reported as errors.
scripts.help:lintx:11: echo If any such issues are present at the time of a
scripts.help:lintx:12: echo of a commit, presuming the standard git hooks
scripts.help:lintx:13: echo this project sets up are in place, the commit
scripts.help:lint:check:01: echo This is like the 'lint' script but only
scripts.help:lint:check:02: echo reports problems; does not modify any of
scripts.help:lint:check:03: echo your source files. Note that this script
scripts.help:lint:check:04: echo might not report any errors but then a run
scripts.help:lint:check:05: echo of the 'lint' script might modify files.
scripts.help:lint:check:06: echo That can happen because 'prettier' does not
scripts.help:lint:check:07: echo have a 'diagnostic' mode in which it
scripts.help:lint:check:08: echo reports discrepancies with its preferred
scripts.help:lint:check:09: echo formatting, while some formatting not
scripts.help:lint:check:10: echo preferred by prettier is nevertheless
scripts.help:lint:list:1: echo This is like the 'lint' script but only
scripts.help:lint:list:2: echo _lists_ the files that would be changed.
scripts.help:lint:list:3: echo It does not modify any source files or report
scripts.help:lint:list:4: echo what the problems were or report any problems
scripts.help:lint:list:5: echo that the tools do not know how to fix.
scripts.help:lint:staged: echo Only for internal use in the pre-commit hook.
scripts.postinstall: python3 -m venv .venv && cd tools && node pyrun.mjs python -m pip install -U pip && node pyrun.mjs pip install -r requirements.txt
